events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a tree on the evening of April 30th and has filed a claim for damages incurred.
The claim was reviewed and appropriately categorised under the Auto Accident cluster due to collision damage to the customer's car.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to act as a point of contact and to assist the customer throughout the claim process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that an investigation will commence promptly to address the customer's situation.
The agent requested the customer submit all relevant documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the car repair estimate.
The customer submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed damage photos and a formal repair estimate from the authorized service center.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and background circumstances of the collision to determine the claim's validity.
Investigation concluded confirming the accident was accidental, with no contributory negligence, and the damage assessment matched the submitted documents.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount that fully covers the repair costs as per the submitted estimate, with additional coverage for rental vehicle.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the settlement offer and the professionalism of the claims process handled so far.
The claim was officially approved based on the thorough investigation and agreement on settlement terms, authorizing prompt payment.
The insurance company issued a payment covering the full agreed settlement amount directly to the repair shop to expedite the vehicle repairs.
After confirmation that the vehicle repairs were completed to the customer's satisfaction, the claim was formally closed with no outstanding issues.
